intro: Asteriscus intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate asterisk, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, giving it a star-like appearance. Asteriscus intermedius is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
